name: 'Til I Hear You Sing Quiz | Christian Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: The song "Alas, and Did My Savior Bleed" contains which of the following lines?
questions.explanation:
His Soul in anguish stood.

	Issac Watts wrote the words in 1707 and Hugh Wilson added music in 1800. The chorus of the song says:"At the cross, at the cross where I first saw the light,And the burden of my heart rolled away,It was there by faith I received my sight,And now I am happy all the day!"

questions.text: What song has the line, "The shadow of a mighty rock within a weary land"?
questions.explanation:
Beneath the Cross of Jesus.

	The words for "Beneath the Cross of Jesus" was written in 1868 by Elizabeth C. Celphane. The music was added in 1881 by Frederick C. Maker. This song contains five stanzas (verses) but no chorus.

questions.text: When all the verses are added this song has nine verses. The music was written by George J. Elvey in 1868. Do you know what this song is?
options: Come Thou Fount of Many Blessings
Christ the Lord is Risen Today
questions.explanation:
Crown Him With Many Crowns.

	Two different people wrote the lyrics to this song. Verses 1, 4, 5, 6,and 9 were written by Matthew Bridges in 1852. Verses 2, 3, and 7, 8 were written by Godfrey Thring in 1874. One of the verses says:"Crown Him the Lord of life, who triumphed over the grave,And rose victorious in the strife for those He came to save.His glories now we sing, who died, and rose on high,Who died eternal life to bring, and lives that death may die."

questions.text:
If I gave you the chorus it would give the title away, so what song has this verse, 
"Standing by a purpose true,
Heeding God's command,
Honor them, the faithful few!
All hail to Daniel's band!"?
options: David Rejoiced in God His Strength
questions.explanation:
Dare to Be a Daniel.

	Phillip P. Bliss wrote both the lyrics and music for this song in 1873 for his Sunday School class in Illinois. The chorus says,"Dare to be a Daniel,Dare to stand alone!Dare to have a purpose firm!Dare to make it known."

questions.text: "The First Noel" is a well known Christmas carol found in the hymnals. Which of these isn't a line in the song?
options: To seek for a King was their intent
Was to certain poor shepherds in fields as they lay
questions.explanation:
Jesus, how I adore Thee.

	"The First Noel" is believed to have been written in the 13th century sometime. The chorus of the song says,"Noel, Noel, Noel, Noel,Born is the King of Israel."

questions.text: What word completes the title (and part of the chorus): "Give Me That Old Time__________"?
questions.explanation:
religion.

	"Give Me That Old Time Religion" is sometimes sung "Tis That Old Time Religion". The song was an African-American spiritual.

questions.text: In 1866 what did lyricist A. Katherine Hankey love to tell?
questions.correct: the story of unseen things above
questions.explanation:
the story of unseen things above.

	"I Love the Story"'s music was written by William G. Fischer in 1869. This song was originally a very long poem of over 50 stanzas.

questions.text: What word is song after every line in the song "Jesus Christ is Risen Today"?
questions.explanation:
Alleluia!.

	The words to this song were written originally in the 14th century. The music was written in 1817 Robert Williams. In 1837, John Roberts added the harmony.  The first verse says, "Jesus Christ is risen today, Alleluia!Our triumphant holy day, Alleluia!Who did once, upon the cross, Alleluia!Suffer to redeem our loss, Alleluia!"

questions.text: What are we "Leaning On" according to the song where the title starts with "Leaning On"?
questions.explanation:
the everlasting arms.

	The words to "Leaning on the Everlasting Arms" was written by Elisha A. Hoffman in 1887. The music was written by Anthony J. Showalter (no year was given). The first verse and chorus says,  "What a fellowship, what a joy divine,Leaning on the everlasting arms;What a blessedness, what a peace is mine,Leaning on the everlasting arms. Refrain Leaning, leaning, safe and secure from all alarms;Leaning, leaning, leaning on the everlasting arms."

questions.text: In the song "My Hope Is Built" the singer says "On Christ the Solid Rock I stand all other ground is _____________" what?
questions.explanation:
sinking sand.

	"My Hope is Built" was written by Edward Mote around 1834. The music was written by William B. Bradbury in 1863. The first verse says,"My hope is built on nothing lessThan Jesus' blood and righteousness.I dare not trust the sweetest frame,But wholly trust in Jesus' Name."
